seo.title: Best time to visit Positano
seo.description: Month by month: weather, crowds and ferries.

intro: Plan your visit with realistic expectations around weather, crowds, and ferry availability.
Use the seasonal matrix and month-by-month notes to decide when Positano matches your priorities.

sections.title: Weather / crowds / prices matrix
body: Peak (Jun–Aug) = hot, crowded, and highest prices. Shoulder (Apr–May, Sep–Oct) = milder weather and better value. Winter (Nov–Mar) = quiet with reduced services.

sections.title: Month-by-month notes
body: April: ferries start; mild temperatures and lighter crowds.
May: excellent weather; more departures; weekends busier.
June–August: peak season; heat and queues — pre-book transport and activities.
September: warm sea and a touch calmer than August.
October: shoulder season; ferries wind down toward the end of the month.
November–March: quiet low season with reduced services; buses become the backbone.
Ferry frequency increases through spring, peaks in summer, and winds down late October.

schemaMonths.name: April
schemaMonths.note: Start of ferry season; mild temps; fewer crowds.

schemaMonths.name: May
schemaMonths.note: Great weather; ferries frequent; busier weekends.

schemaMonths.name: June–August
schemaMonths.note: Peak season; hot; book transport/activities early.

schemaMonths.name: September
schemaMonths.note: Warm sea; slightly fewer crowds than August.

schemaMonths.name: October
schemaMonths.note: Shoulder season; ferries wind down late month.

schemaMonths.name: November–March
schemaMonths.note: Quiet; many services reduced; buses primary transport.

a: Late June to early September typically offers the warmest water for swimming.
